page.title: 18PETROCKSTOWE FARMS AND STOCK
page.content: Over 90% of the area is farmland and we studied 14 farms, accounting for 79% of the 12 sq.km survey area. Farms range in size from 70 - 450 acres, but the{average is 168 acres.}The princi- pal stock is{sheep,}with an average flock of 250 per farm but a total of 5000 sheep + lambs in the area, or 2 for every acre farmed, although 1 farm grazes 6 sheep per acre. The stock pattern has changed since 1980 due to economic pressures on dairy farmers. Nonetheless there are still some 1000 cattle, with 5 dairy cows to every 4 beef stock. Additionally there are 200 pigs, 50 poultry + game birds. Generally stock is mixed: only one farm runs sheep exclusively & one is purely a cattle farm. Let grazing accounts for 10% of the acreage farmed. Stock is generally sold at {Hatherleigh's}weekly auction{market.
